title: Natural Language Processing and Word Embeddings

questions.question: What is the main focus of Natural Language Processing (NLP)?
choices: Interaction between computers and human language
questions.answer: Interaction between computers and human language

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a key component of NLP?
questions.answer: Quantum computing

questions.question: What is tokenization in NLP?
choices: Breaking text into individual words or subwords
Analyzing the grammatical structure of sentences
questions.answer: Breaking text into individual words or subwords

questions.question: What does Named Entity Recognition (NER) involve?
choices: Identifying and classifying named entities in text
questions.answer: Identifying and classifying named entities in text

questions.question: What are word embeddings in NLP?
choices: Learned representations of text where words with similar meanings have similar representations
Random assignments of numbers to words
questions.answer: Learned representations of text where words with similar meanings have similar representations

questions.question: What is an advantage of using word embeddings?
choices: They capture semantic relationships between words
They eliminate the need for dictionaries
questions.answer: They capture semantic relationships between words

questions.question: What is Word2Vec?
choices: A popular algorithm for generating word embeddings
questions.answer: A popular algorithm for generating word embeddings

questions.question: What are the two main architectures of Word2Vec?
choices: Continuous Bag of Words (CBOW) and Skip-gram
questions.answer: Continuous Bag of Words (CBOW) and Skip-gram

questions.question: What is a challenge in applying NLP to Tetum and Portuguese languages in Timor-Leste?
questions.answer: Limited digital resources and datasets

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a potential application of NLP in Tetum and Portuguese languages?
questions.answer: Weather prediction

questions.question: What is the distributional hypothesis in the context of word embeddings?
choices: Words that appear in similar contexts tend to have similar meanings
Words are randomly distributed in a text
The distribution of words follows a normal curve
Words with similar spellings have similar meanings
questions.answer: Words that appear in similar contexts tend to have similar meanings

questions.question: How do word embeddings typically represent words?
choices: As continuous vectors of real numbers
questions.answer: As continuous vectors of real numbers

questions.question: What is a benefit of using pre-trained word embeddings?
choices: They eliminate the need for further training
They work for all languages without modification
They improve performance on tasks with limited training data
They reduce the need for computational resources
questions.answer: They improve performance on tasks with limited training data

questions.question: Which NLP task involves assigning grammatical categories to words?
questions.answer: Part-of-speech tagging

questions.question: What is the purpose of semantic analysis in NLP?
choices: To break text into individual words
To assign grammatical categories to words
To determine the meaning of words and sentences
To identify named entities in text
questions.answer: To determine the meaning of words and sentences

questions.question: Which of the following is a challenge in NLP?
choices: Lack of contextual meaning in text
questions.answer: Ambiguity in language

questions.question: What is the typical dimensionality of word embedding vectors?
questions.answer: 50-300 dimensions

questions.question: How does Word2Vec learn word embeddings?
choices: By analyzing the grammatical structure of sentences
By predicting words based on their context
By counting word frequencies in a corpus
questions.answer: By predicting words based on their context

questions.question: What is a potential application of NLP in preserving Timorese languages?
choices: Eliminating the need for human translators
questions.answer: Creating digital dictionaries and corpora

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical step in the Word2Vec algorithm?
choices: Initializing random vectors for each word
Sliding a window over the text corpus
Updating word vectors based on prediction errors
questions.answer: Manually adjusting vector values

questions.question: What is the main advantage of using dense vector representations for words?
choices: They capture semantic relationships between words
They eliminate the need for context
questions.answer: They capture semantic relationships between words

questions.question: Which of the following tasks can benefit from using word embeddings?
questions.answer: Sentiment analysis

questions.question: What is a challenge in developing NLP applications for Tetum?
questions.answer: Lack of standardized orthography

questions.question: How can word embeddings assist in machine translation?
choices: By eliminating the need for bilingual corpora
By helping align words across languages
questions.answer: By helping align words across languages

questions.question: What is the primary goal of text summarization in NLP?
choices: To translate text into multiple languages
To generate concise and meaningful summaries of longer texts
To identify grammatical errors in text
questions.answer: To generate concise and meaningful summaries of longer texts

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential ethical concern in developing NLP applications for Timorese languages?
questions.answer: Potential bias in language models

questions.question: What is the main difference between CBOW and Skip-gram architectures in Word2Vec?
choices: CBOW predicts the target word from context, while Skip-gram predicts context from the target word
CBOW works only for English, while Skip-gram works for all languages
questions.answer: CBOW predicts the target word from context, while Skip-gram predicts context from the target word

questions.question: How can NLP technologies potentially impact language preservation in Timor-Leste?
choices: By replacing traditional language learning methods
By creating digital resources and tools for language documentation and learning
By standardizing all Timorese languages into one
By translating all Timorese content into English
questions.answer: By creating digital resources and tools for language documentation and learning

questions.question: What is a key challenge in implementing machine translation systems between Tetum and other languages?
choices: Lack of interest from the population
Limited parallel corpora and linguistic resources
Tetum's similarity to major world languages
questions.answer: Limited parallel corpora and linguistic resources

questions.question: How might word embeddings be used to explore Timorese culture?
choices: By visualizing relationships between culturally significant concepts
questions.answer: By visualizing relationships between culturally significant concepts
